subject: Re: [junit] Re: @Before vs constructor
msgSnippet: Ahmed, That s good feedback.  Were you a JUnit 3 user?  At design time, a big concern was to have something that looked familiar to JUnit 3 users, and I could
messageBody:
Ahmed,

That's good feedback. Were you a JUnit 3 user? At design time, a big
concern was to have something that looked familiar to JUnit 3 users,
and I could imagine that we missed something that would have been
intuitive to completely new users. Thanks,

David Saff

On Fri, Oct 24, 2008 at 1:34 AM, Ahmed S Ashour <asashour@...> wrote:
> Dear David,
>
>> This is by design. ... the @Before methods are run, for all
>
>> practical purposes, right after the constructor.
>
>> Does that answer your question?
>
> Sure it does.
>
> I am not on a solid background to argue, but I feel it wasn't
> intuitive.
>
> Thanks a lot,
> Ahmed
>
>
